'Threatening' letters sent to Boston public schools

Police stepped up security after several Boston Public Schools received letters postmarked from Texas with "threatening and disturbing content," including references to Al Qaeda and Nazis, officials said. (4:12 p.m.)

Head of Cambridge honorary society on leave after resume flap

Leslie Berlowitz of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences requested time away after reports she inflated her resume. (5 p.m.)

DA: Ally of Lantigua arrested for corruption

A political supporter of the embattled Lawrence mayor was charged with larceny and fraud today. (1:57 p.m.)
